data.title: The Best Minnesota Timberwolves Point Guards of All Time
data.meta_description: Over 500 sports fans have voted on the 40+ athletes on Best Minnesota Timberwolves Point Guards of All Time. Current Top 3: Sam Cassell, Stephon Marbury, ...
data.text:
Ranked By

3.2K votes

544 voters

3 reranks

Voting Rules

Vote up the players who had the most success for the Minnesota Timberwolves

Latest additions: Mike Conley, Jr.

Most divisive: Jeff Teague

Over 500 Ranker voters have come together to rank this list of The Best Minnesota Timberwolves Point Guards of All Time

Big fan of Minnesota basketball? Then check out this list of Minnesota Timberwolves point guards. It includes almost every point guard from throughout Minnesota Timberwolves history, including current point guards and past ones. Featuring some of the greatest NBA point guards of all time, the best Timberwolves PGs include Ricky Rubio, Sam Cassell, Terrell Brandon, and Stephon Marbury.

In the 2021-22 NBA season, the current Minnesota Timberwolves starting PGs and backup PGs are D'Angelo Russell, Patrick Beverly, and Jordan McLaughlin.

Who are the best point guards in Minnesota Timberwolves history? Vote below and help decide the greatest Minnesota Timberwolves point guards of all time!

Birthplace : Baltimore, Maryland

Nationality : United States of America

Team : Houston Rockets, Phoenix Suns, Dallas Mavericks, New Jersey Nets, Milwaukee Bucks

Position : Point guard

Minnesota Timberwolves: 2003–2005

With a reputation for clutch performances and exceptional leadership, Sam Cassell joined the Minnesota Timberwolves in 2003 after being traded from the Milwaukee Bucks. His veteran experience and crafty playmaking ability helped the Timberwolves reach their first and only Western Conference Finals appearance in 2004. Cassell's individual accolades include earning an NBA All-Star nod in 2004 and being named to the All-NBA Second Team during his tenure with the Timberwolves. His time with the organization may have been brief, but Cassell's impact on the court and his ability to elevate the play of those around him forever solidified his place among the best point guards in Timberwolves history.

Birthplace : New York City, New York, USA

Nationality : United States of America

Position : Point guard, Shooting guard

Minnesota Timberwolves: 1996–1999

Stephon Marbury burst onto the Minnesota Timberwolves scene in 1996 when he was drafted as the 4th overall pick, quickly making an impact with his fast-paced style and scoring ability. Known for his creative ball-handling skills and dynamic playmaking, Marbury formed a formidable duo with Kevin Garnett, earning All-Rookie First Team honors in 1997 and being selected as an NBA All-Star in 2001. Despite not earning any championships or major awards during his time with the Timberwolves, Marbury's undeniable talent and impact led him to be one of the best point guards in the team's history. His lasting contributions and dynamic athleticism continue to be remembered by fans, making him a staple in discussions about the greatest Timberwolves point guards.

Birthplace : El Masnou, Spain

Nationality : Spain

Team : Cleveland Cavaliers

Position : Point guard

Minnesota Timberwolves: 2011–2017, 2020-2021

Signing with the Timberwolves in 2011, Ricky Rubio immediately established himself as an elite passer known for his unselfishness and precise court vision. His charismatic style of play and defensive tenacity energized the team, quickly endearing him to Minnesota fans. Despite not having any major awards or championships during his time with the Timberwolves, Rubio's savvy playmaking and innate ability to create opportunities for his teammates solidified him as one of the best point guards in the organization's history. His impact on the team's style of play and his flair for the dramatic continue to leave a lasting impression on fans and players alike.

Birthplace : Denver, Colorado

Nationality : United States of America

Team : Los Angeles Clippers

Position : Point guard

Minnesota Timberwolves: 2000–2002

Acquiring Chauncey Billups in free agency in 2000 proved to be a vital addition to the Minnesota Timberwolves roster, with his steady hand and poised leadership on the court. Known for his clutch shooting and basketball IQ, Billups' brief tenure with the Timberwolves helped set the foundation for his eventual rise as one of the NBA's best point guards. Although he did not earn major awards or championships during his time with the organization, his efficient playmaking and steadfast demeanor earned him respect among fans and teammates. Billups' contributions and growth while with the Timberwolves have secured his place as one of the best point guards to have ever played for the franchise.

Birthplace : Chicago, Illinois

Nationality : United States of America

Team : New York Knicks

Position : Point guard

Minnesota Timberwolves: 2018–2019

Joining the Minnesota Timberwolves in 2018 after being waived by the Utah Jazz, Derrick Rose provided an immediate spark and veteran presence to the team. Known for his explosive athleticism and ability to finish at the rim, Rose's resurgence with the Timberwolves was highlighted by a memorable 50-point game, showcasing his scoring prowess. Despite not winning any awards or championships with the team, his electrifying style of play and perseverance through injury struggles endeared him to fans and solidified his place among the franchise's best point guards. Rose's time in Minnesota, though brief, left an indelible impact on the team and its supporters.

Birthplace : Fayetteville, Arkansas

Nationality : United States of America

Team : Utah Jazz

Position : Point guard

Minnesota Timberwolves: 2023-ongoing

Mike Conley, a man whose court vision and intelligence make him a standout in the point guard position for the Timberwolves, takes control of the game like a maestro in an orchestra. Granted, he may not be the flashiest player on the court, but his ability to understand and anticipate the game's flow, coupled with his masterful passing skills, form a cornerstone of Minnesota's offensive strategy. Known for his strategic dribbling and knack for creating opportunities, Conley keeps defenders on their toes, cleverly maneuvering through defenses like a fox in a henhouse, setting up his teammates for countless successful plays.

Michael Alex Conley Jr. (born October 11, 1987) is an American professional basketball player for the Utah Jazz of the National Basketball Association (NBA). He was a member of the Memphis Grizzlies since the team drafted him with the fourth overall pick in the 2007 NBA draft before being traded in 2019 to the Utah Jazz. Conley is the son of Mike Conley Sr., an Olympic gold and silver medalist in track and field. He is the Grizzlies' all-time leading scorer.
